verses.verse: Wine <WH3196> is a mocker, <WH9238> strong <WH7941> drink <WH7941> a brawler, <WH1993> And whoever <WH3605> is intoxicated <WH7686> by it is not wise. <WH2449>
The terror <WH367> of a king <WH4428> is like the growling <WH5099> of a lion; <WH3715> He who provokes <WH9378> him to anger <WH9378> forfeits <WH2398> his own life. <WH5315>
Keeping <WH7674> away <WH7674> from strife <WH7379> is an honor <WH9202> for a man, <WH376> But any <WH3605> fool <WH191> will quarrel. <WH1566>
The sluggard <WH6102> does not plow <WH9177> after <WH4480> the autumn, <WH2779> So he begs <WH7592> during the harvest <WH7105> and has <WH369> nothing. <WH369>
A plan <WH6098> in the heart <WH3820> of a man <WH376> is [like] deep <WH6013> water, <WH4325> But a man <WH376> of understanding <WH8394> draws <WH1802> it out.
Many <WH7230> a man <WH120> proclaims <WH7121> his own <WH376> loyalty, <WH2617> But who <WH4310> can find <WH4672> a trustworthy <WH529> man <WH376>?
A righteous <WH6662> man <WH6662> who walks <WH1980> in his integrity <WH8537> â€“ How blessed <WH835> are his sons <WH1121> after <WH310> him.
A king <WH4428> who sits <WH3427> on the throne <WH3678> of justice <WH1779> Disperses <WH2219> all <WH3605> evil <WH9563> with his eyes. <WH5869>
Who <WH4310> can say, <WH559> "I have cleansed <WH2135> my heart, <WH3820> I am pure <WH2891> from my sin <WH9128>"?
Differing <WH68> weights <WH68> and differing <WH374> measures, <WH374> Both <WH1571> <WH8147> of them are abominable <WH8441> to the Lord. <WH3068>
It is by his deeds <WH4611> that a lad <WH5288> distinguishes <WH5234> himself If <WH518> his conduct <WH6467> is pure <WH2134> and right. <WH3477>
The hearing <WH8085> ear <WH241> and the seeing <WH7200> eye, <WH5869> The Lord <WH3068> has made <WH6213> both <WH1571> <WH8147> of them.
Do not love <WH157> sleep, <WH8142> lest <WH6435> you become <WH3423> poor; <WH3423> Open <WH6491> your eyes, <WH5869> [and] you will be satisfied <WH7646> with food. <WH3899>
"Bad, <WH7451> bad, <WH7451>" says <WH559> the buyer; <WH7069> But when he goes <WH235> his way, <WH235> then <WH227> he boasts. <WH1984>
There <WH3426> is gold, <WH2091> and an abundance <WH7230> of jewels; <WH6443> But the lips <WH8193> of knowledge <WH1847> are a more <WH637> precious <WH3366> thing. <WH3627>
Take <WH3947> his garment <WH899> when <WH3588> he becomes <WH6148> surety <WH6148> for a stranger; <WH2114> And for foreigners, <WH5237> hold <WH9111> him in pledge. <WH9111>
Bread <WH3899> obtained by falsehood <WH8267> is sweet <WH6156> to a man, <WH376> But afterward <WH310> his mouth <WH6310> will be filled <WH4390> with gravel. <WH2687>
Prepare <WH3559> plans <WH4284> by consultation, <WH6098> And make <WH6213> war <WH4421> by wise <WH8458> guidance. <WH8458>
He who goes <WH1980> about as a slanderer <WH7400> reveals <WH1540> secrets, <WH5475> Therefore do not associate <WH6148> with a gossip. <WH9464> <WH8193>
He who curses <WH7043> his father or his mother, <WH1> His lamp <WH517> will go <WH5216> out in time <WH1846> of darkness. <WH380>
An inheritance <WH5159> gained <WH9048> hurriedly <WH926> at the beginning, <WH7223> Will not be blessed <WH1288> in the end. <WH319>
Do not say, <WH559> "I will repay <WH9608> evil <WH9563>"; Wait <WH6960> for the Lord, <WH3068> and He will save <WH3467> you.
Differing <WH68> weights <WH68> are an abomination <WH8441> to the Lord, <WH3068> And a false <WH4820> scale <WH3976> is not good. <WH2896>
Man <WH120>'s steps <WH4703> are [ordained] by the Lord, <WH3068> How <WH4100> then can man understand <WH995> his way <WH1870>?
It is a snare <WH4170> for a man <WH120> to say <WH9236> rashly, <WH9236> "It is holy! <WH6944>" And after <WH310> the vows <WH5088> to make <WH1239> inquiry. <WH1239>
A wise <WH2450> king <WH4428> winnows <WH2219> the wicked, <WH7563> And drives <WH7725> the [threshing] wheel <WH212> over <WH5921> them.
The spirit <WH5397> of man <WH120> is the lamp <WH5216> of the Lord, <WH3068> Searching <WH2664> all <WH3605> the innermost <WH2315> parts <WH2315> of his being. <WH990>
Loyalty <WH2617> and truth <WH571> preserve <WH5341> the king, <WH4428> And he upholds <WH5582> his throne <WH3678> by righteousness. <WH2617>
The glory <WH8597> of young <WH970> men <WH970> is their strength, <WH3581> And the honor <WH1926> of old <WH2205> men <WH2205> is their gray <WH7872> hair. <WH7872>
Stripes <WH2250> that wound <WH6482> scour <WH4838> away evil, <WH9563> And strokes <WH4347> [reach] the innermost <WH2315> parts. <WH990>
